name: F. Yui and Mahjong Set
statement:
Yui is a girl who enjoys playing Mahjong. She has a mysterious set which
consists of tiles (this set can be empty). Each tile has an integer
value between 1 and n, and in the set have the same value. So the set
can contain at most n^2 tiles.You want to figure out which values are on
the tiles. But Yui is shy, she prefers to play a guessing game with
you.Let’s call a set consisting of tiles if their values are the same.
For example,
{2,
,2,
,2
} is a triplet, but
{2,
,3,
,3
} is not.Let’s call a set consisting of tiles if their values are
consecutive integers. For example,
{2,
,3,
,4
} is a straight, but
{1,
,3,
,5
} is not.At first, Yui gives you the number of triplet subsets and
straight subsets of the initial set respectively. After that, you can
insert a tile with an integer value between 1 and n into the set . Every
time you insert a tile, you will get the number of triplet subsets and
straight subsets of the current set as well.Note that two tiles with the
same value are treated different. In other words, in the set
{1,
,1,
,2,
,2,
,3
} you can find 4 subsets
{1,
,2,
,3
}.Try to guess the number of tiles in the initial set with value i for
all integers i from 1 to n.
